title: Spanish matador, 57, fighting for life after being gored by bull in ring horror

A Spanish matador is fighting for his life after being gored by a bull.

Friends and family of Mariano De la Viña, 57, say it is a 'miracle' that he is still alive after suffering three cardiac arrests as a result of being gored.

The injured bullfighter has undergone two lengthy operations, following the mauling at the Plaza de Toros in Zaragoza, Spain.

De la Viña was taking part in the El Pilar fair when he was charged by a bull which knocked him to the floor, gored him, lifted him into the air and dragged him across the bullring.

(Image: Javier Cebollada/EPA-EFE/REX)

The beast then attacked him for the second time, leaving the matador with a 27-centimetre wound through his groin and a 22-centimetre cut between his rectum and bladder.

His femoral artery and another artery was severed

in the right Scarpa triangle, which severed his femoral artery, and another 22 centimetre goring between his rectum and bladder, tearing another vital artery.

(Image: Javier Cebollada/EPA-EFE/REX)

His surgeon described his injuries, including two severed arteries, as "cataclysmic" and said every hour would count towards his survival chances.

Now it looks as though his life has been saved as he has come off a ventilator and started to regain consciousness, with his blood flow appearing to have been stabilised.

His condition is still very serious but doctors are more optimistic.

(Image: Javier Cebollada/EPA-EFE/REX)

Dr. Carlos Val-Carreres, chief surgeon of the infirmary of the bullring of Zaragoza, told the bullfighting newspaper Mundotoro: "We have saved the life of Mariano De la Viña in the first instance but it is still very serious.

He is in the Intensive Care Unit of the Quirónsalud Zaragoza Hospital, with the latest bulletin confirming: "He is stable but very serious.

"After sedation withdrawal, the patient's neurological response begins to be positive. Circulation is good in his right leg."
description: Mariano De la Viña was gored in the groin and flung into the air during a fiesta at the Plaza de Toros in Zaragoza, Spain
